abstract.text: Value types for representing and working with SMPTE timecode.
Returns the total number of frames elapsed.
Returns the current timecode converted to a duration in audio samples
at the given sample rate, with floating-point sub-sample duration.
Sample rate is expressed in Hz. (ie: 48KHz would be passed as 48000)
Timecode subframes component. Represents a partial division of a frame.
(This components store makes it convenient to port around timecode component values agnostic
of frame rate or other properties to other Timecode initializers or methods.)
Returns the timecode rounded up to the next whole component value.
If all subsequently smaller component values are already 0 then no
has no effect, as it is the smallest component.
Returns the timecode offset by a delta amount.
Wraps around the clock if needed, as set by the
Returns the timecode rounded down to the given component.
If all subsequently smaller component values are already 0 then no
has no effect, as it is the smallest component.
Box describing a total elapsed frame count.
Primitive struct describing timecode values, agnostic of frame rate.
minus 1 subframe expressed as frames where the integer portion is
whole frames and the fractional portion is the subframes unit interval.
Validates and clamps all timecode components to valid values at the current
distance between the current timecode and another timecode.
Transforms the timecode in-place using the given transformer.
Round the timecode up to the next whole component value if necessary.
If all subsequently smaller component values are already 0 then no
has no effect, as it is the smallest component.
Returns valid range of values for a timecode component, given the current
object converted to a new frame rate.
instances, optionally using a timeline that does not start at
00:00:00:00. Timeline length and wrap point is determined by the
property. The timeline is considered linear for 24 hours (or
100 days) from this start time, wrapping around the upper limit.
Enum describing the maximum timecode ceiling.
A timecode transformer containing one or more transform rules in series.
(Lossy) Returns the current timecode converted to a duration in
real-time (wall-clock time), based on the frame rate.
Represents the base (denominator) a partial division of a frame.
Working with intervals between two timecodes.
if timecode including subframes is zero (00:00:00:00.00).
Returns the current timecode converted to a duration in audio samples
at the given sample rate, rounded to the nearest sample.
Sample rate is expressed in Hz. (ie: 48KHz would be passed as 48000)
Represents an interval duration of timecode, either positive or negative.
(This property store makes it convenient to port around relevant timecode attributes to
Returns a set of invalid components, if any.
A fully valid timecode will return an empty set.
Returns the timecode expressed as Feet+Frames.
Offsets the current timecode by a delta amount.
Wraps around the clock if needed, as set by the
Truncates timecode after the given component and all subsequently smaller components.
If all subsequently smaller component values are already 0 then no
has no effect, as it is the smallest component.
Returns the time location as a
Returns the time location as a rational fraction.
string formatter capable of displaying invalid timecode components with special formatting.
minus 1 subframe expressed as total subframes.
Returns the largest subframe value displayable before rolling over to the next frame.
Returns the timecode transformed by the given transformer.
